  "title": "Event Manager",
  "description": "Strivo Labs - Our client is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Event Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced and results-driven Events Manager to lead the execution, operational excellence, team performance, and financial success of a key portion of corporate event portfolio.
	The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership, financial management, and project execution skills, ensuring that strategic directives from the Head of Events are translated into flawless delivery.
	This role requires a professional who thrives in fast-paced environments, makes high-impact operational decisions, and consistently delivers exceptional client experiences.


Key Responsibilities
Operational Strategy &amp; Execution Direction:


	Lead the development and implementation of detailed operational strategies, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and quality control frameworks for all events.
	Translate strategic goals into clear, actionable, and measurable execution plans for the event operations team.
	Oversee the full lifecycle of the events portfolio &mdash; from concept refinement and planning to execution, delivery, and post-event evaluation.
	Independently evaluate, recommend, and integrate event technology solutions and systems that enhance team efficiency and client satisfaction.
	Exercise decision-making authority on critical operational matters including budget reallocations, vendor management, and on-site issue resolution.


Financial Management &amp; Portfolio P&amp;L:


	Take full ownership of the Profit &amp; Loss (P&amp;L) performance for the assigned events portfolio, proactively driving cost efficiencies and revenue optimization.
	Manage and control individual event budgets with autonomy, providing summarized financial reports and variance analyses to the Head of Events.
	Negotiate and finalize contracts with venues and general suppliers within established financial parameters.
	Oversee event financial reconciliations and prepare comprehensive monthly P&amp;L reports and performance metrics for executive review.


Team Leadership &amp; Mentorship:


	Directly supervise, mentor, and coach team members, ensuring clarity of roles, expectations, and performance outcomes.
	Manage departmental workflows including task delegation, scheduling, and resource allocation to ensure optimal productivity and balanced workloads.
	Identify talent development needs and implement training or professional development programs to enhance internal capability and overall service quality.


Senior Stakeholder &amp; Risk Management:


	Serve as the primary management-level point of contact for high-value clients throughout the execution phase, ensuring their expectations are exceeded.
	Hold independent authority to approve and activate contingency plans in response to operational, safety, or logistical risks during events.
	Review and sign off on key event deliverables &mdash; including floor plans, menus, and speaker logistics &mdash; ensuring complete alignment with our client&#39;s quality standards before execution.


Required Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Education: Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Event Management, Hospitality, or Business Administration. A Master&rsquo;s degree or recognized certification (CMP, CSEP) is a strong advantage.
	Experience: 5&ndash;8 years of progressive experience in the events industry, including at least 3 years in a managerial capacity overseeing teams and holding direct P&amp;L accountability.
	Autonomy: Demonstrated ability to independently manage large-scale projects, make strategic decisions under pressure, and deliver outcomes with minimal supervision.
	Financial Acumen: Strong expertise in P&amp;L reporting, cost management, and complex contract negotiation.
	Leadership &amp; Mentorship: Proven record of successfully leading teams, driving collaboration, and fostering a high-performance culture.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, salary expectation, and a brief note about their experience to:&nbsp;hiring@strivolabs.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Events Manager&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",

General Manager Job at Resource Intermediaries Limited




        
    

        
        Resource Intermediaries Limited (RIL) is a distinguished HR Outsourcing and Consulting firm, specializing in customized recruitment solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of companies. Our proficiency extends across a wide spectrum of positions, ranging from top-tier executives to entry-level positions, covering technical, contractual, semi-skilled, and unskilled roles. Additionally, we are recognized experts in providing a range of services including Fumigation Services, Janitorial Services, Payroll Administration, Expatriate Management, Manpower Planning, Executive Training, and more.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a talented professional who is passionate about socio-economic development through agricultural and Agro-allied investments.
	Day-to-day management of cultivation and equipment.
	Supervising department heads.
	Manage the farm's finances
	Ensure compliance with regulations,
	Implement sustainable farming techniques and modern agricultural technologies
	Collaborate with R&D to improve crop yields.


Qualifications and Skills


	Bachelor's Degree in Agriculture (Master's preferred) and a minimum of 10 years of progressive leadership experience in commercial farming, with at least five years in a general management position.
	A proven track record of managing large-scale farms (over 500 hectares),
	Strong business skills including budgeting and strategic planning, and knowledge of modern agricultural practices and technology.
	Excellent leadership and communication skills.
	Familiarity with Nigerian and West African agricultural policies, climates, and challenges.


Salary
N500,000 - N750,000 per month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: vadisa@resourceintermediaries.org using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
